definition: (used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: They also called for legally enshrined debt brakes in all eurozone countries.
sentences.chinese: 他們還要求在所有歐元區國家立法實現“債務制動”。

sentences.english: The Eurozone and euro are kaput.
sentences.chinese: 歐元區和歐元都失敗了。

sentences.english: But the issue of how to handle the Greek crisis continues to vex euro-zone leaders.
sentences.chinese: 但如何處理希臘危機問題繼續煩惱歐元區領導人。

sentences.english: Still Chen says he hopes and believes that euro zone countries can overcome the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 陳還說他希望並相信歐元區國家能夠克服這個危機。

sentences.english: The eurozone will not come out of recession for at least six months, according to BDO estimates.
sentences.chinese: 據柏德浩估計，歐元區至少需要6個月才能走出衰退。

sentences.english: The euro bloc likely expanded modestly in the third quarter, thanks to strong growth in the early summer.
sentences.chinese: 由於夏初的強勁增長，三季度歐元區可能小幅擴張。

sentences.english: Therefore, Eurogroup proposed to the ECOFIN to approve the two countries' programmes.
sentences.chinese: 因此，歐元區財長提出建議，批准這兩個國家的方案。

sentences.english: It is plausible that China will put some money into euro-zone debt alongside other non-European countries.
sentences.chinese: 中國貌似有可能購買非歐盟國家的一些歐元區債務。

sentences.english: It is still hard to imagine a euro-zone member defaulting.
sentences.chinese: 歐元區成員國違約仍然是很難想象的一件事。

sentences.english: If Germany were the leaver, it would face an inward flood.
sentences.chinese: 如果德國要退出歐元區，它將面對一場國內資金流動。

sentences.english: That markets now discriminate among euro-area credits is a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 市場如今對歐元區各國信用的區別對待是一件好事。

sentences.english: The eurozone has been limping along like a man with one leg, he told the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴聽衆，歐元區一直像只有一條腿的人一樣跛行。

sentences.english: That is why we go into a phase with a new quality of cooperation within the eurozone.
sentences.chinese: 這是爲什麼我們要在歐元區更深入開展合作的原因。

sentences.english: The euro zone also needs a monetary-policy shift.
sentences.chinese: 歐元區的貨幣政策也需要轉變。

sentences.english: The latest round of the eurozone crisis could not have come at a better time.
sentences.chinese: 最近一輪的歐元區危機適逢其時。

sentences.english: This will likely apply to U. K. and Euro-zone as well.
sentences.chinese: 英國和歐元區情況將有可能一樣。

definition: to flee from danger/to avoid danger/to minimize risk/(finance) hedge
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
